medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp, localized right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient felt dull, achy back pain that slowly shifted toward her periumbilical region. By her examination date, the pain was localized to the RLQ with some pain in the left lower quadrant (LLQ). She preferred to have her knees in a flexed position and her head leaning forward. Her temperature was 102.6Â°F, and she experienced some nausea since a previous date. She noted her pain changed in intensity, and after taking over-the-counter pain medications, she felt a little bit better, but Tylenol did not help her discomfort.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Osteoporosis, Bronchiectasis, Mitral valve prolapse.
